messages.title: I have rashes all over my hands and it itches a lot
messages.content: Patient presenting with rashes and joint pain.
Doctor, I have rashes and my joints are aching.
When did the rash first appear?
It started about two weeks ago. It hasn't gone away.
messages.caption: Photo of rash taken at initial presentation.

messages.content: Here are the vital signs: Heart rate: 80/min, Blood pressure: 118/76 mm Hg, Temperature: 37.2Â°C. No abnormalities noted.
Skin examination findings: Red, raised patches on the forearms and legs, some fading with bruising. Slight tenderness but no pain.
messages.caption: Skin findings during physical examination.

messages.content: Based on the history and examination findings, select the details you think are relevant to the diagnosis.
Relevant: Rash lasting over 24 hours, resolving with bruising. Morning joint pain in wrists and knees. No new exposures.
